response.text: Blockade has been lifted for you, good luck!
Well yes, we have decided to temporarily close the gate for new comers. But that's only because we need help.

option.title: Help
option.text: What can I do to help?

response.text: Let's make a deal. I got three jobs that needs to be done, and nobody around here has the balls to do any of them. I can't send Razor because he's the chief of my guards; and let's just be direct - these jobs can get you killed, and I can't afford to lose Razor. But if you get these jobs done for me - and I don't care how you do it - not only will I let you through my gate, but I'll also guide you deeper into the zone. What do you think?
Good! Here's the first job: right outside the village, up north, there is a barn which we have been using to grow potatoes. We hate eating potatoes but we use them to produce alcohol.

You see, the alcohol is our main trade - the eggheads among the mutant hunters pay a lot of dough for it, and that's how we've been surviving. But recently a bunch of assholes who call themselves "Legionaires" raided our farm and took it for themselves, along with all the distillers. And that puts us in some deep shit.

option.title: Continue
option.text: I see. So you need me to take it back for you, right?

response.text: Exactly. Get rid of the Legionaires; and if you can, check on the potatoes for us, they probably haven't been watered for a long time. The farm is directly north from the village, on the other side of the hill. I'll go head and tell Razor to let you through the gate. Now grab your gun and get to it!

option.title: Guns
option.text: Do you have some guns for me?

response.text: No, I don't. What the hell are you doing in the zone without a shooter?
Alright, take your time.

I'm a business man. As such, I hate adventures. Now, adventure and risk are totally different things. I take risks, which is why I'm here in this God forsaken place. My son, on the other hand, is completely the opposite.
He lives in Kiev. He wanted to come here with me, but I didn't let him. He's a man of hot-headed adventures and he'll get himself killed here.
Did you get our brewery back?

option.title: Farm
option.text: I cleared the farm for you.

option.title: Farm
option.text: The farm is clear, and I turned on the irrigators too.

response.text: Great! I'll send our boys to take over the farm. Are you ready for the next task?
Well done! You save us a lot of work. I'll send our boys to take over the farm. Here, they would want you to have this. Now, are you ready for the next task?
Now that we got our brewery back, we need to deliver goods to our customers. No, that's not your job - you don't know the way around and our customers don't trust you.

For the past several months, the Legionnaires held the train station, so the only way out of Zernaskaya is through the sewers under the church. Since we haven't been there for a while, the whole area got overrun with ghouls.

They are humans at the first stage of mutation after contracting the Tungus Complex. They aren't too dangerous individually, but if many of them gang up on you in a tight space, it's certain death. I need you to clear the Ghouls so we can use the underground sewer to transport goods out. Before you go, see if you can find Hans somewhere in the village. I heard he needed some help.
Yes, they are my transporters. Three weeks ago I sent them on a delivery but didn't hear from them since.

option.title: Death
option.text: I found their dead bodies. They were killed by ghouls.

response.text: Oh! What a shame. At least they didn't run away with my money, right? Were they carrying anything?

option.title: Yes
option.text: Yes, I found 190 rubles. Ivan asked to return them to you and send their savings to his mother.

option.title: No
option.text: No, didn't find anything on them.

response.text: Hmm... Well seems like they are loyal boys after all. I'll send their savings out. And thank you for bringing the money back.
You don't have the money. I'll just take whatever you have and use their savings to cover the rest.
Them bastards! I knew I couldn't trust them! Guess I'll just keep their savings to cover my loss.
Is the task completed?

option.title: Yes
option.text: Both church grounds and the sewer are cleared.

response.text: Impressive! You are really getting the hang of it. I just have one more task for you and then I'll introduce you to a Ghoul hunter, and you'll get rich in no time! Are you ready?

option.title: No
option.text: I have other business to take care of.

response.text: Suit yourself.

Alright. You'll be facing some anomalies this time, so listen carefully. Go up north and then turn east at the fork. You'll find a path leading to the old gas station. The path is littered with anomalies, so throw some rocks with each step so you don't get ripped into pieces.

Consider them as traps laid by the Zone. Each time there's a Visitation the anomalies are rearranged, so there's no way to map their locations. But if you are careful with your steps you can avoid them. When you get to the gas station, look for the "Mad Mechanic" anomaly.

Well, I haven't seen it myself, but I heard it can repair your weapon automatically - if you do it right. I don't know how it works exactly so I need you to investigate. Here, take some worn pistols and experiment with them. And this old AK too - I need you to bring it back to me in perfect conditions. You can't fool me, though. A gun with perfect conditions is very hard to come by in the Zone. Good luck.
You break it, you bought it.

option.title: AK47
option.text: I fixed the AK, it's good as new.

response.text: Let me take a look. Ha! No gun smiths in the Zone can do a better job than this. You know what this is? Business, opportunity, money! Well, as a man of his words, I will point you to the right direction.
Hey there, what can I do you for?
